workflow.name: Auto-send WooCommerce invoices via WhatsApp with Rapiwa API
workflow.description:
## Who is this for?
This workflow listens for new or updated WooCommerce orders, cleans and structures the order data, processes orders in batches, and standardizes WhatsApp phone numbers. It verifies phone numbers via the Rapiwa API, sends invoice links or messages to verified numbers, and logs results into separate Google Sheets tabs for verified and unverified numbers. Throttling and looping are managed using batch processing and wait delays.

## What this Workflow Does
- Receives order events (e.g., `order.updated`) from WooCommerce or a similar trigger.
- Extracts customer, billing/shipping address, product list, and invoice link from the order payload.
- Processes orders/items in batches for controlled throughput.
- Cleans and normalizes phone numbers by removing non-digit characters.
- Verifies whether a phone number is registered on WhatsApp using the Rapiwa API.
- If verified, sends a personalized message or invoice link via Rapiwa's `send-message` endpoint.
- If not verified, logs the customer as unverified in Google Sheets.
- Logs every send attempt (status and validity) into Google Sheets.
- Uses Wait nodes and batching to avoid API rate limits.

## Key Features
- Trigger-based automation (WooCommerce trigger; adaptable to Shopify webhook).
- Batch processing using `SplitInBatches` for stable throughput.
- Phone number cleaning using JavaScript (`waNoStr.replace(/\D/g, "")`).
- Pre-send WhatsApp verification via Rapiwa to reduce failed sends.
- Conditional branching (IF node) between verified and unverified flows.
- Personalized message templates that include product and customer fields.
- Logging to Google Sheets with separate flows for verified/sent and unverified/not sent.
- Wait node for throttling and looping control.


## Requirements
- Running n8n instance with nodes: HTTP Request, Code, SplitInBatches, IF, Google Sheets, Wait, and a WooCommerce trigger (or equivalent).
- Rapiwa account and Bearer token for verify/send endpoints.
- Google account and Google Sheets access with OAuth2 credentials.
- WooCommerce store access credentials (or Shopify credentials if adapting).
- Incoming order payloads containing `billing` and `line_items` fields.

## Google Sheet format (example rows)
**A Google Sheet** formatted like this ‚û§ [Sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1NVYsvOg3mzsAGlzJiL7-2mtkN-5gsmqd3fG8hboE3vk/edit?usp=sharing)

| Customer Name  | Phone Number  | Email Address     | Address     | Product Title    | Product ID | Size | Quantity | Total Price | Product Image                                                                                                                              | Invoice Link                                                                                                                                                                                           | Status   | Validity   |
| -------------- | ------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------- | ------------------------------------ | ---------- | ---- | -------- | ----------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | -------- | ---------- |
| Abdul Mannan| 8801322827799 | contact@spagreen.net | mirpur| T-Shirt - XL | 110        | XL   | 1        | BDT 499.00  | https://your_shop_domain/Product/gg.img | https://your_shop_domain/INV/DAS | sent     | verified   |
| Abdul Mannan| 8801322827799 | contact@spagreen.net | mirpur| T-Shirt - XL | 110        | XL   | 1        | BDT 499.00  | https://your_shop_domain/Product/gg.img | https://your_shop_domain/INV/DAS | not sent | unverified |


## Important Notes
- The Code nodes assume `billing` and `line_items` exist in the incoming payload; update mappings if your source differs.
- The message template references `products[0]`; if orders contain multiple items, update logic to summarize or iterate products.
- Start testing with small batches to avoid accidental mass messaging and to respect Rapiwa rate limits.

## Useful Links
- **Dashboard:** [https://app.rapiwa.com](https://app.rapiwa.com/login)
- **Official Website:** [https://rapiwa.com](https://rapiwa.com/)
- **Documentation:** [https://docs.rapiwa.com](https://docs.rapiwa.com/)

## Support & Help
- **WhatsApp**: [Chat on WhatsApp](https://wa.me/8801322827799)
- **Discord**: [SpaGreen Community](https://discord.gg/SsCChWEP)
- **Facebook Group**: [SpaGreen Support](https://www.facebook.com/groups/spagreenbd)
- **Website**: [https://spagreen.net](https://spagreen.net)
- **Developer Portfolio**: [Codecanyon SpaGreen](https://codecanyon.net/user/spagreen/portfolio)

workflow.name: Send WooCommerce Invoices on WhatsApp Automatically Using Rapiwa API

nodes.name: Append Rows in Sheet Verified & Sent
Append Rows in Sheet Unverified & Not sent

parameters.content:
# Auto-Send WooCommerce Invoices via WhatsApp with Rapiwa API

## Overview
This workflow listens for new or updated WooCommerce orders, cleans and structures the order data, processes orders in batches, and standardizes WhatsApp phone numbers. It verifies phone numbers via the Rapiwa API, sends invoice links or messages to verified numbers, and logs results into separate Google Sheets tabs for verified and unverified numbers. Throttling and looping are managed using batch processing and wait delays.


## Features
- Extracts customer, address, product, and invoice_link from order payloads.
- Batch processing for controlled throughput.
- WhatsApp verification step prior to sending messages.
- Conditional branching based on verification result (`$json.data.exists == "true"`).
- Personalized message templates using product and customer fields.
- Logging to Google Sheets with distinct columns for verified and unverified flows.


## Google Sheet Required Columns
**A Google Sheet** formatted like this ‚û§ [Sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1NVYsvOg3mzsAGlzJiL7-2mtkN-5gsmqd3fG8hboE3vk/edit?usp=sharing)


## How to Use This Workflow
1. Configure credentials:
   - Add Rapiwa Bearer token to the `Rapiwa Bearer Auth` credential.
   - Add Google Sheets OAuth2 credential and ensure the spreadsheet ID is accessible.
   - Configure WooCommerce credentials for the trigger (or replace the trigger with a Shopify webhook and set Shopify credentials).
2. Verify the Google Sheet has the required columns listed above.
4. Watch the execution path: webhook ‚Üí mapping ‚Üí batch loop ‚Üí number cleaning ‚Üí verify ‚Üí IF ‚Üí send or log ‚Üí append sheet ‚Üí wait ‚Üí continue.

## Customization Ideas
- Replace WooCommerce trigger with a Shopify webhook trigger and adapt the mapping code.
- Change the message template to include different product or customer fields.
- Add filters in the mapping code to target customers (e.g., `total_spent > 5000`, order count, or tags).
- Add fallback channels (SMS or email) for unverified numbers before marking as 'not sent'.
- Send an admin summary (Slack or email) after each run.
- Enrich customer data with external lookups (CRM/loyalty service) before sending.

## Useful Links
- **Dashboard:** [https://app.rapiwa.com](https://app.rapiwa.com/login)
- **Official Website:** [https://rapiwa.com](https://rapiwa.com/)
- **Documentation:** [https://docs.rapiwa.com](https://docs.rapiwa.com/)

## If (Condition)
- Purpose: Branch the workflow based on Rapiwa verification response.
- It's route to `Send Message Using Rapiwa` or `Unverified & Not sent`.


## Send Message Using Rapiwa
- Purpose: Send a personalized WhatsApp message (text) via Rapiwa to the verified number.
- Credentials: `httpBearerAuth` (Rapiwa Bearer Auth)


## Append Rows in Sheet Verified & Sent
- Purpose: Append a row for each successful send with `status: sent` and `validity: verified`.


## Append Rows in Sheet Unverified & Not sent
- Purpose: Append a row for unverified numbers with `validity: unverified` and `status: not sent`.

## 1. Clean WhatsApp Number
- Purpose: Ensure the `number` field is a string and remove non-digit characters.
- Why it matters: Ensures Rapiwa receives a consistent numeric-only phone number.


## 2. Check valid whatsapp number Using Rapiwa
- Purpose: Verify whether the cleaned number is registered on WhatsApp via Rapiwa.

## 1. WooCommerce Trigger
- Trigger event: `order. complete`
- Purpose: Entry point for the workflow. Receives order complete from WooCommerce.
- Credentials: `wooCommerceApi` (example name: "WooCommerce (get customer)").

## 2. Clean Webhooks Response Data
- Purpose: Transform the incoming order payload into a compact structure 
- Why it matters: Normalizes different incoming payload shapes into a single downstream contract.

## How to Use ‚Äî Step-by-step Setup
1) Configure credentials in n8n
   - Rapiwa: add your Bearer token to an HTTP Bearer credential (`Rapiwa Bearer Auth`).
   - Google Sheets: connect OAuth2 credentials (`Google Sheets`).
   - WooCommerce: add WooCommerce API credentials for the trigger (`WooCommerce (get customer)`), or configure Shopify credentials if adapting.

3) Configure nodes
   - Trigger: `WooCommerce Trigger` (event: `order.updated`) or a Shopify webhook.
   - Code: `Clean Webhooks Response Data` ‚Äî map incoming order into `{ data: { customer, products, invoice_link } }`.
   - Code: `Clean WhatsApp Number` ‚Äî remove non-digit characters and normalize numbers.
   - HTTP Request: `Check valid whatsapp number Using Rapiwa` ‚Äî POST `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/verify-whatsapp` with `{ number }`.
   - HTTP Request: `Send Message Using Rapiwa` ‚Äî POST `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/send-message` with `{ number, message_type, message }`.

main.node: Append Rows in Sheet Unverified & Not sent
Append Rows in Sheet Verified & Sent

user.name: Rapiwa
user.bio:
Simple, Reliable, Cost-Effective WhatsApp API
Rapiwa is a fast, reliable WhatsApp Business API Solution built for developers. Manage multiple sessions, scale your messaging, and enjoy transparent pricing with no per-message fees.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
